channel.title: Maintenance on Ksbigbass
channel.description: Recent content in Maintenance on Ksbigbass

item.title: Ranger Boats: Road Armor Trailer Axle Problems
item.description:
Very common, unfortunately, a know bad weld exists on the early road armor trailers.

The biggest issue was with the single axle trailers for the 188’s and the 519’s but also with the tandem trailers.

This could save a life. As “new to me” owners should be aware of this important safety issue.

2004-2010 years mainly affected.

Broken Trailer Axle on this Ranger 520 bass boat.

Check the welds on the axles see if there is any visible cracking or separation.

item.title: Bolts to Add a Jackplate 519vx
item.description:
Bolts to Add on a Jackplate to Ranger 519vx

Bolts to Add a Jackplate Ranger 519vx: Since I have the out for a rebuild I’ve decided to add a jackplate to the Ranger. Jackplate’s offer adjustability to the motor height and in turn the height of the prop shaft.

item.title: Dead or Blown Powerhead
item.description:
Dead or Blown Powerhead: It has happened again.

Optimax blew up.

Dead and blown powerhead: So many of us have been there. Whether or not we get a warning buzzer that tells us or just a gut feeling, we all know when we’ve blown up another outboard motor.

item.title: How To: Clean Boat Carpet
item.description:
Cleaning your bass boat marine carpet, how to get the blood, grease, and slime out. The latest trend in carpet cleaning is here and it might not be what your thinking.

Shaving cream is an effective, inexpensive fix for stained and dirty boat carpet.

Barbasol boat carpet cleaning

How To: Clean Boat Carpet

item.title: End of a Marathon
item.description:
End of a Marathon: Sure we all have had one of those days.   Well today was Tourney day.   After a long day of work Friday we ended up in Lawrence around 9pm, just in time to find out it was KU’s Graduation Weekend.  

End of a Marathon: Have you ever had one of those days where things went wrong.

The scramble was on to find a hotel room!  

First stop was a no-go, and we quickly came to the realization that we might be spending the night in the truck at the ramp.  As luck would have it the very first hotel  we called had an available room.  We promptly made it to our room after check in and settled in ready for the derby wake up at 04:30.

item.title: That's the Brakes
item.description: That’s the brakes: Headed to Clinton Lake early Saturday morning with a cool overcast start to the day.   All seemed well as I headed out for the day.  I had hooked the boat up the night before so all I had to do was climb in and go.  I made it to Greg’s house without any problems,  and then on to the lake.

item.title: Boat Towing Gas Savers!
item.description:
Boat Towing Gas Savers: It’s important to keep the rig rolling down the road.  Small things I do that can help keep a couple dollars in my pocket.

You hear it all the time to check your tire pressure.  

But make Sure and Check the SPARE on both the tow and boat!!
